title: Matchmaking (role priority) needs some tweaking IMO
body:
So I think I've gotten my First Preference once or twice. Other than that, I'm basically always getting the second pref. Whether it be jungle or fill. It doesn't matter. I'll still rarely get FP. So I propose that Riot makes the system search a little longer before it starts resorting to a shitty ass second role. It's so bad that I'm considering putting my first pref as second pref.

Of course you literal serious people will give me a whole powerpoint presentation on why or what. Put it simply; no one here is retarded.

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Captain Cancer,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=4hTjxlra,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-02-23T07:35:36.001+0000)
>
> Change the game so support isn't so boring for most players. If Riot actually tried to support ideas like double jungle and making an adc that is capable of surviving 1v2 or incentivize roaming supports way more than just sit in lane and babysit adc, then there wouldn't be such bad queue times. 
> It would also make matches and competitive games a lot more dynamic and interesting. E.g. Watching a conventional team go up against a double jungle team and the way their play changes.
> I 4 stack a lot, and without fail we always have to accept 10 minute queue times. As soon as one of us sighs and accepts that we have to make support our secondary, we get an instant queue.

Things like double jungle (and solo lane adc) are completely viable, the only issue is that you need really strong communication to pull it off well. The best way to do these kinds of things is in a premade 5 team (made possible by dynamic que), so you can communicate using voice as well as minimize the flame from people that aren't in on the new meta you are creating. 

Que times as premades are a whole different ball game, as the system tried to match 4/5 premades with other 4/5 premades (due to the perceived advantage of voice chat)

On the whole super long wait time topic, its mainly because people want to play carry roles.

* Take x number of people online, in the same mmr bracket, and queuing at a certain time (which in OCE is bound to be tiny, especially with more and more people turning to norms due to the wait times/ "potato teams"),
* take half away for being premade (the best way to play the game)
* then take away another 3/5 who have their primary/secondary as a mix of mid/top (the proportion of qued players in this category probably goes up, as the elo goes down)
* then you have the remaining players as potential que partners (assuming they are split evenly amongst the 3 remaining roles (which in itself, is highly unlikely)

What I'm tying to say here, is that getting your primary isn't so much about waiting an extra couple of minutes on top of the already ridic que times, its about being the lucky one in a mess of numbers.
I guess so. Defs a problem that has the potential to be long term killer if Riot doesn't plan a fix.

Change the game so support isn't so boring for most players. If Riot actually tried to support ideas like double jungle and making an adc that is capable of surviving 1v2 or incentivize roaming supports way more than just sit in lane and babysit adc, then there wouldn't be such bad queue times. 
It would also make matches and competitive games a lot more dynamic and interesting. E.g. Watching a conventional team go up against a double jungle team and the way their play changes.
I 4 stack a lot, and without fail we always have to accept 10 minute queue times. As soon as one of us sighs and accepts that we have to make support our secondary, we get an instant queue.
